title: Upgrading App (Retaining Feature Access/Settings)
custom_preconds:
Given the user has the current Store build version installed from Google Play
And the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user has set Favorite Team(s)
custom_steps:
When the user logs in to Google Play with a whitelisted account
And updates to the new version available in Alpha
And launches the app
custom_expected:
Then the user's login information will be retained
And the user's feature access will be retained
And the user's Favorite Teams will be retained
And the user's notification settings will be retained (verify that notifications are actually still received according to settings)
Verify the build number corresponds to the build under test (this can be located by selecting the About MLB tab for mobile and tablets or on the Settings screen for TV in the bottom right corner in small print)

title: Handset - Video Launch Points (50% automated)-> Gameday yet to be automated-> Cannot confirm video controls
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to play video from the following sections:

custom_steps_separated.content: Team Page videos section (handset only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Highlights tab on the Watch View
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: News Article (has an embedded video to lead it off)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Video token from a News Article (within the article as you scroll down)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the embedded highlight will play
And the highlight can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Feed tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content: Gameday Videos section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight opens and can be watched in its entirety

custom_steps_separated.content:
Condensed Game or Game Recap
Note: Navigate to a final game from the regular season on the scoreboard, click the game to view Gameday screen, Click Videos tab from Gameday screen. Scroll all the way down to see Game Recap and Condensed Game.
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight Condensed Game or Game Recap opens and can be watched in its entirety

title: In-App Purchase
custom_preconds: Free Trial Testing

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps the MLB Audio option
AND purchases the subscription through the Play Store purchase flow
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the transaction is successful
AND the user can dismiss the "Follow the Game Wherever You Go" screen
AND the user will have MLB Audio access (Ex. Gameday Audio)
AND the user will not see Lite ads

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the MLB Audio user then accesses the MLB.tv paywall
AND purchases MLB.tv Monthly successfully
AND then links to a MLB account from the "Follow the Game Wherever You Go" screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will have access to MLB.tv and Gameday Audio
AND the user will not see Lite ads 
AND the MLB account will display in purchases

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user uninstalls the build
AND reinstalls the build
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the App will automatically restore the purchase for the user 
AND the user's purchases (MLB Audio Monthly and MLB.tv Monthly) will be restored
AND the user will have MLB Audio and MLB.tv access

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user installs the build on another device
AND launches the app
AND accesses a paywall
AND logs in with their MLB account (FROM STEP 2)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will have access to MLB Audio and MLB.tv

title: MLB.tv - Switching Feeds
custom_preconds: Given a user is on an Android device
custom_steps: When a user is watching an MLB.TV video
custom_expected: Accounts - https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/QAspace/2019+Commerce+Entitlements

custom_steps_separated.content: AND MLB.TV Premium user taps on another feed of the game in the broadcast options (comes up when you press the tv icon)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Media Framework check appears
and the user is let into the other feed

custom_steps_separated.content: AND MLB.TV Premium user taps on a feed that is blacked out
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Media Framework check appears
and the blackout message appears

custom_steps_separated.content: AND single team user taps on a the other feed of the game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Media Framework check appears
and the single team message appears restricting them from watching the feed

title: Chromecast-> Yet to be automated
custom_preconds:
Given MLB APP has been installed
and the user is on the same network as a Google Chromecast device
and the user is testing in Alpha or Prod

This testing doesn't apply to amazon devices as chromecast is not supported
Chromecast functionality will not be available in QA

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the section header (e.g. Scoreboard, News, Team Page, Standings)
and taps on the Google Cast icon in the top right corner
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN an overlay will display
AND all Chromecast devices found on the network will appear
AND all device names will display correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects an available Chromecast device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Google Cast icon will show as enabled
AND it will now appear filled in with white

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches an MLB.TV feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the app is connected to a Chromecast device
and the user launches VOD content (video highlights, video in news article, Gameday video)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the VOD should launch on the Chromecast device
And the user should be taken to the video controller view on their handset

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify player controls function while casting
(play/pause, Closed Captioning, switching feeds)
custom_steps_separated.expected: The expected behavior should occur on the Chromecast device

title: Location Permissions-> Implicitly automated by way of standard running
custom_steps:
GIVEN a user launches a fresh install of the app
WHEN the user reaches the favorite team selector
THEN the user should be presented with a location permissions popup

GIVEN a user launching a fresh install of the MLB app
WHEN the user denies location permission at the favorite team selector
AND then attempts to watch a game stream
THEN the user should be prompted with another location prompt
AND when the user denies that prompt they should see a "Location not enabled" screen with an "Enable" button that will take them to the App Info page for MLB where they can enable location permissions (screenshot below)

NOTE: There is a known bug where the "Location not enabled, please enable location to continue" text does not currently display. This is currently expected, so do not mark this test as failed for this bug. Delete this note when the bug has been addressed.

![](index.php?/attachments/get/11778237)

User can stream Audio for 5 minutes
User can stop Audio
User can pause and play Audio

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the dark mode color theme is seen
